entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: okay sometimes when i am feeling tense i turn on the fish tank screensaver hey i know it is not hawaii but it is the best i have got what do you do to relax

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: well now i am really back into it i used to do it a while then i got away from it but it is meditation i practice meditation and i try to do it twice a day in the morning and at night before i go to sleep i work with oprah and deepak chopra and anybody else who provides me with meditation and i use that to calm my body

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: how are you at controlling your temper

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i can generally control my temper sometimes i get set off i guess like any other han person being but i work at trying to keep a moderate and temperate temper in personality

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: when was the last time you argued with someone and what was it about

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: oh wow we i argued with my daughter the other day about something i said and i did not mean to say it to hurt her but it obviously did and we argued about that what my intentions were my intentions were never to hurt her and maybe what i said did and that is what started the argent

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: how did you feel in that moment

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: oh god i felt terrible because i i never intended to hurt my daughter and i never would wanna hurt her and i felt bad that she had been hurt by what i had said so i had to have to guard my words and watch my thoughts

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: tell me about your relationship with your family

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: well i do not have much of a relationship with my family with my brothers and sisters and mother and father my parents live far away so it is just my two daughters here with me and we have a pretty good relationship you know we try to work my my daughter is a makeup artist and i am a photographer so we work a lot together in the industry so sometimes i think we are up on each other too close we need a little more space

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: has that gotten you in trouble

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah when i say the wrong things it is

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: could you have done anything to avoid it

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah i could have stayed home

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: tell me about a situation that you wish you had handled differently

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: wow i am trying to think about a situation maybe the handling of how i me and my husband divorced i think i could have handled that a little differently

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: can you tell me about that

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: well we we i think we really loved each other a lot and we just it was it was something that had come to a a end and the way we separated was kind of explosive and i think both of us could have handled it better but i think i played a part in in keeping a lot of drama going cause i was hurt that we were breaking up and kinda devastated cause i wanted my child to be raised with her father so i think it looking back now which is you know hindsight is twenty twenty vision i could have handled things a little better but what can you do you do the best that you can at that time if you knew better you would do better

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah tell me about the hardest decision you have ever had to make

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: the hardest decision i have ever had to make the hardest decision i have ever had to make was i was on my way to work as an enrollment counselor on a plane had a stroke was going to make an a connection and to get on the other plane to and then go to the hospital and a doctor was sitting behind me and he told me that i could not get on that plane because i might have another stroke that was a hard decision cause i was in dallas texas all by myself i did not i mean i was in there with an employee but i would be left all by myself cause my employees had to go on to montgomery alabama where we were headed and i had to make a decision should i stay or should i go but my life was in the balance so i made the decision to stay and go to the hospital but that was a hard one

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: oh my gosh how did you feel in that moment

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: ugh overwhelmed i mean here i am on my way to work you know i flew to different states every week and to help kids get get admitted into college and here i am on my way to work and i am on a plane and i feel this weird feeling coming over the left side of my body and i say my prayers and i go to sleep and then when i wake up to get off the plane i can not remove my luggage from the overhead compartment which i did every week so i knew something was wrong it was it was when you to your life and the whole world in your hand and you do not know what is gonna happen next so it was very disturbing very traatic and i you know you do not know what is happening to you it is so the weirdest thing riding to the hospital in a medical ambulance that was a weird experience

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah i am sorry

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah but i am here i you know i survived it the doctor told me nobody survives it a stroke on a plane and i survived so the universe was not finished with me yet

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah how easy is it for you to get a good night is sleep

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: you know what that is sometimes i have a little problem with it sleeping a little bit sometimes i i get wired up i get wired up just because i am one of those real energetic persons and i have to finish what i set out to do and until i finish i can not go to sleep so sometimes it is hard for me to go to sleep other times i can lay down and just go but depends on what is going on in my head

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: what are you like when you do not sleep well

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i am sluggish probably a little on edge but i try and keep a a upbeat personality i am a real energetic person so i try to but you know if you are tired your body is still talking to you so

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: h how have you been feeling lately

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: lately i have been feeling really well except i have been having some problems because i have a since i had the stroke i have nerve damage in my hand and in my face and so i just it is i thought it is been over a year since i had the stroke but i thought by now it would have gotten a little better and it has not but i am so grateful to be alive that that is really minor minor compared to the bigger picture and i was not fortunately fortunately my i did not lose my facial structure or you know my face is not screwed up like a lot of people are i still can use my hands i still can shoot with my camera even though my left hand is is diminished in use but i can shoot with my right hand as a photographer so i can still keep doing my work so you know i have to keep a good upbeat energy going on for me to keep for me to be successful

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah have you ever been diagnosed with ptsd

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: no but i went through depression from being knocked unconscious five times when i was a school teacher every ball there was that you could name soccer ball baseball basketball name that ball hit me in my head and i suffered from having like sleep apnea and not being able to sleep from being hit so many times and knocked unconscious in the head so

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: okay do you still go to therapy now

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: no only i do not go to therapy because i do not i do not have any medical right now so i am not able to get therapy they only offer that to people with medical it is hard to get it and then i do not i am not working yeah it sucks i am not working right now because i am still trying to get my disability

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah that sucks

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: so that i can get well cause i wanna be a fulfilled han being and i wanna be totally and you know the system it will be almost two years before i go for a hearing so that is kind of depressing to think after all the years i have been working since i was sixteen and it is taking me it is been over a year it was a year i had the stroke february two thousand twelve and we are now in march of two thousand thirteen and i will not have a hearing until september two thousand thirteen just to tell me if i get the disability or not that is been very depressing for me because i am wondering where i lived off my savings in the last year and i got put my daughter through college she finished and now she is having to take care of me and she is still looking for a job and my life is kinda up in the air right now cause i am wondering what comes next and so i am just praying for guidance
